member.name: M:ASC.Api.Documents.DocumentsApi.UploadFileToMy(System.IO.Stream,System.Net.Mime.ContentType,System.Net.Mime.ContentDisposition,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Web.HttpPostedFileBase})
member.summary: Uploads a file specified in the request to the "My documents" section by single file uploading or standart multipart/form-data method.
member.short: Upload a file to my section
member.param: List of files when posted as multipart/form-data
member.remarks:
Upload can be done in 2 different ways:
  1. Using single file upload. You should set the Content-Type & Content-Disposition headers to specify the file name and content type, and send the file to the request body.
  2. Using standart multipart/form-data method.

  2. Using standart multipart/form-data method.

  2. Using standart multipart/form-data method.
member.param: List of files when posted as multipart/form-data
Creates a new file if it already exists or not
If true, uploads documents in the original formats as well
Keeps converting status after finishing or not

member.name: M:ASC.Api.Documents.DocumentsApi.CreateUploadSession(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a session to upload large files in multiple chunks to the folder with the ID specified in the request.
member.param: Folder which is relative to the selected folder
member.remarks: Each chunk can have different length but the length should be multiple of 512 and greater or equal to 10 mb. Last chunk can have any size. After the initial response to the request with the 200 OK status, you must get the location field value from the response. Send all your chunks to this location. Each chunk must be sent in the exact order the chunks appear in the file. After receiving each chunk, the server will respond with the current information about the upload session if no errors occurred. When the number of bytes uploaded is equal to the number of bytes you sent in the initial request, the server responds with the 201 Created status and sends you information about the uploaded file.
member.returns:
Information about created session which includes:
  • id: unique ID of this upload session
  • created: UTC time when the session was created
  • expired: UTC time when the session will expire if no chunks are sent before that time
  • location: URL where you should send your next chunk
  • bytes_uploaded: number of bytes uploaded for the specific upload ID
  • bytes_total: total number of bytes which will be uploaded

member.name: M:ASC.Api.Documents.DocumentsApi.CreateEditSession(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a session to edit the existing file with multiple chunks (needed for WebDAV).

member.name: M:ASC.Api.Documents.DocumentsApi.CreateFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new folder with the title specified in the request. The parent folder ID can be also specified.

member.name: M:ASC.Api.Documents.DocumentsApi.CreateFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new file in the "My documents" section with the title specified in the request.
member.short: Create a file in my section

param.name: title
param.remark: Allowed values: the file must have one of the following extensions: DOCX, XLSX, PPTX

member.remarks: In case an extension for the file title differs from DOCX/XLSX/PPTX and belongs to one of the known text, spreadsheet or presentation formats, it will be changed to DOCX/XLSX/PPTX accordingly. If the file extension is not set or is unknown, the DOCX extension will be added to the file title.

member.name: M:ASC.Api.Documents.DocumentsApi.CreateFile(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new file in the specified folder with the title specified in the request.

param.name: title
param.remark: Allowed values: the file must have one of the following extensions: DOCX, XLSX, PPTX

member.param: The ability to create files of any extension
member.remarks: In case an extension for the file title differs from DOCX/XLSX/PPTX and belongs to one of the known text, spreadsheet or presentation formats, it will be changed to DOCX/XLSX/PPTX accordingly. If the file extension is not set or is unknown, the DOCX extension will be added to the file title.

member.summary: Sets the sharing settings to a file with the ID specified in the request.
